Package org.kmfahey.jchessgame

Class BoardArrays

java.lang.Object
org.kmfahey.jchessgame.BoardArrays
public final class BoardArrays extends Object
Contains a collection of utility methods for manipulating 2d int arrays that represent chessboards, plus a few other methods. The 8x8 boardArray that's used as the internal chessboard representation by the Chessboard class is manipulated explicitly by most methods in this class. Chessboard's logic relies on these utility methods to manipulate and test its boardArray, as does MinimaxRunner and BoardView, so the methods were refactored into a standalone utility static class.

      public static String coordsToAlgNotn(int xCoord, int yCoord)
      Translates coordinates of a square on a chessboard, into the 2-character algebraic notation String that refers to the same square.
      Parameters:
      xCoord - The x coordinate of the square.
      yCoord - The y coordinate of the square.
      Returns:
      The algebraic notation for the same square (a 2-character String).

    • findKing

      public static int[] findKing(int[][] boardArray, int kingColor)
      Finds the king of the specified color in its boardArray argument.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - An int[8][8] array that is the chessboard representation used explicitly by methods in this static class, and internally by the Chessboard object.
      kingColor - The color of the king to search for.
      Returns:
      An int[2] containing the x and y coordinates the king was found at.

    • shuffleMovesArray

      public static void shuffleMovesArray(int[][] movesArray, int usedLength)
      Selects the first n arrays in the given array-of-arrays, and shuffles them using the Fisher-Yates in-place shuffling algorithm.
      Parameters:
      movesArray - The moves array to shuffle a subsequence of.
      usedLength - The length of the subsequence of the moves array to shuffle, counting from the beginning of the array-of-arrays.

    • isKingInCheckmate

      public static boolean isKingInCheckmate(int[][] boardArray, int colorsTurnItIs, int colorOnTop)
      Tests whether the king of the specified color is in checkmate. It does this by executing a method that populates an array with all possible moves, and testing if its return value of the index of the first empty array is still 0 (and therefore the list of possible moves is of length 0). The methods used to generate moves are constrained that they may not leave their side's king in check after the move is completed. If no move satisfies those constraints, the king is in checkmate.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - An int[8][8] array that is the chessboard representation used explicitly by methods in this static class, and internally by the Chessboard object.
      colorsTurnItIs - The color of the piece.
      colorOnTop - The color playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      True if the specified king is in checkmate, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • generatePawnsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateRooksMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateBishopsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateKnightsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateQueensMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateKingsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)

    • generatePossibleMoves

      public static int generatePossibleMoves(int[][] boardArray, int[][] movesArray, int colorsTurnItIs, int colorOnTop) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Generates possible moves for every piece in the boardArray argument of the specified color. It saves them to its movesArray argument. It returns the index of the first empty array in movesArray after it has filled zero or more arrays with moves.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - An int[8][8] array that is the chessboard representation used explicitly by methods in this static class, and internally by the Chessboard object.
      movesArray - The working int[][7] array to fill moves into.
      colorsTurnItIs - The color of the piece.
      colorOnTop - The color playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      The new value for the index of the first empty array in the int[][7] movesArray.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If an integer in the boardArray argument doesn't parse as a valid composite of integer piece flags.
      See Also:
      • generatePawnsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateRooksMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateBishopsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateKnightsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateQueensMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateKingsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)

    • generatePieceMoves

      public static int generatePieceMoves(int[][] boardArray, int[][] movesArray, int moveIdx, int xIdx, int yIdx, int colorsTurnItIs, int colorOnTop) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Generates possible moves for the piece at the specified location its boardArray first argument, and saves them to its movesArray argument. It returns the index of the first empty array in movesArray after it has filled zero or more arrays with moves.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - An int[8][8] array that is the chessboard representation used explicitly by methods in this static class, and internally by the Chessboard object.
      movesArray - The working int[][7] array to fill moves into.
      moveIdx - The index of the first empty array in movesArray. This value is incremented each time a new move is saved to movesArray, and the final value (still pointing to the
      xIdx - The x index of the location of the piece.
      yIdx - The y index of the location of the piece.
      colorsTurnItIs - The color of the piece.
      colorOnTop - The color playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      The new value for the index of the first empty array in the int[][7] movesArray.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If an integer in the boardArray argument doesn't parse as a valid composite of integer piece flags.
      See Also:
      • generatePawnsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateRooksMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateBishopsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateKnightsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateQueensMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)
      • generateKingsMoves(int[][], int[][], int, int, int, int, int)

    • generatePawnsMoves

      public static int generatePawnsMoves(int[][] boardArray, int[][] movesArray, int moveIdxArg, int xIdx, int yIdx, int colorsTurnItIs, int colorOnTop) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Generates possible moves for the pawn, and saves them to its movesArray argument. It returns the index of the first empty array in movesArray after it has filled zero or more arrays with moves.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - An int[8][8] array that is the chessboard representation used explicitly by methods in this static class, and internally by the Chessboard object.
      movesArray - The working int[][7] array that is populated by generate*sMoves() methods. It may already contain moves for other pieces. It is assumed to be long enough to contain all new moves without checking for overflow.
      moveIdxArg - The index of the first empty array in movesArray. This value is incremented each time a new move is saved to movesArray, and the final value (still pointing to the
      xIdx - The x index of the location of the pawn.
      yIdx - The y index of the location of the pawn.
      colorsTurnItIs - The color of the pawn.
      colorOnTop - The color playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      The new value for the index of the first empty array in the int[][7] movesArray.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the coordinates point to a cell in the boardArray argument that isn't a pawn of the specified color.

    • generateRooksMoves

      public static int generateRooksMoves(int[][] boardArray, int[][] movesArray, int moveIdxArg, int xIdx, int yIdx, int colorsTurnItIs, int colorOnTop) throws IllegalArgumentException

      movesArray - The working int[][7] array that is populated by generate*sMoves() methods. It may already contain moves for other pieces. It is assumed to be long enough to contain all new moves without checking for overflow.
      moveIdxArg - The index of the first empty array in movesArray. This value is incremented each time a new move is saved to movesArray, and the final value (still pointing to the
      xIdx - The x index of the location of the rook.
      yIdx - The y index of the location of the rook.
      colorsTurnItIs - The color of the rook.
      colorOnTop - The color playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      The new value for the index of the first empty array in the int[][7] movesArray.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the coordinates point to a cell in the boardArray argument that isn't a rook of the specified color.

      xIdx - The x index of the location of the bishop.

      xIdx - The x index of the location of the knight.

      Generates possible moves for the queen, and saves them to its movesArray argument. It returns the index of the first empty array in movesArray after it has filled zero or more arrays with moves.

    • generateKingsMoves

      public static int generateKingsMoves(int[][] boardArray, int[][] movesArray, int moveIdxArg, int xIdx, int yIdx, int colorsTurnItIs, int colorOnTop) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Generates possible moves for the king, and save them to the movesArray it's given as an argument. It returns the index of the first empty array in movesArray after it has filled zero or more arrays with moves. It checks each possible move for if it would put the king in check. Of note, if it doesn't find any possible moves for the king, then de facto the king is in checkmate.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - An int[8][8] array that is the chessboard representation used explicitly by methods in this static class, and internally by the Chessboard object.
      movesArray - The working int[][7] array that is populated by generate*sMoves() methods. It may already contain moves for other pieces. It is assumed to be long enough to contain all new moves without checking for overflow.
      moveIdxArg - The index of the first empty array in movesArray. This value is incremented each time a new move is saved to movesArray, and the final value (still pointing to the
      xIdx - The x index of the location of the king.
      yIdx - The y index of the location of the king.
      colorsTurnItIs - The color of the king.
      colorOnTop - The color playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      The new value for the index of the first empty array in the int[][7] movesArray.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the coordinates point to a cell in the boardArray argument that isn't a king of the specified color.
      See Also:
      • isKingInCheck(int[][], int, int)

    • isKingInCheck

      public static boolean isKingInCheck(int[][] boardArray, int colorsTurnItIs, int colorOnTop)
      Tests whether the king of the specified color is in check.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - The int[8][8] array that represents the chessboard.
      colorsTurnItIs - The color of the king to be tested for if it's in check.
      colorOnTop - The color playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      A boolean, whether this color's king is in check.

    • wouldKingBeInCheck

      public static boolean wouldKingBeInCheck(int[][] boardArray, int fromXIdx, int fromYIdx, int toXIdx, int toYIdx, int colorsTurnItIs, int colorOnTop)
      Tests whether the king of the specified color would be in check if a friendly piece in the specified square moved to the specified square.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - The int[8][8] array that represents the chessboard.
      fromXIdx - The x coordinate of the square a friendly piece is moving from, to be treated as empty.
      fromYIdx - The y coordinate of the square a friendly piece is moving from, to be treated as empty.
      toXIdx - The x coordinate of the square a friendly piece is moving to, to be treated as occupied by a friendly piece.
      toYIdx - The x coordinate of the square a friendly piece is moving to, to be treated as occupied by a friendly piece.
      colorsTurnItIs - The color of the king to be tested for if it's in check.
      colorOnTop - The color playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      A boolean, whether any piece on this side has the king in check.

    • wouldKingBeInCheck

      public static boolean wouldKingBeInCheck(int[][] boardArray, int kingXIdx, int kingYIdx, int colorsTurnItIs, int colorOnTop)
      Tests whether the king of the specified color would be in check if it were located in the specified square.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - The int[8][8] array that represents the chessboard.
      colorsTurnItIs - The color of the king to be tested for if it's in check.
      kingXIdx - The x coordinate of the square the king is to be treated as being located in.
      kingYIdx - The y coordinate of the square the king is to be treated as being located in.
      colorOnTop - The color playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      A boolean, whether this color's king is in check.

    • wouldKingBeInCheck

      public static boolean wouldKingBeInCheck(int[][] boardArray, int kingXIdx, int kingYIdx, int fromXIdx, int fromYIdx, int toXIdx, int toYIdx, int colorsTurnItIs, int colorOnTop)
      Tests whether the king of the specified color would be in check if it were located in the specified square and a friendly piece at the specified square moved to the specified square.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - The int[8][8] array that represents the chessboard.
      kingXIdx - The x coordinate of the square the king is to be treated as being located in.
      kingYIdx - The y coordinate of the square the king is to be treated as being located in.
      fromXIdx - The x coordinate of the square a friendly piece is moving from, to be treated as empty.
      fromYIdx - The y coordinate of the square a friendly piece is moving from, to be treated as empty.
      toXIdx - The x coordinate of the square a friendly piece is moving to, to be treated as occupied by a friendly piece.
      toYIdx - The x coordinate of the square a friendly piece is moving to, to be treated as occupied by a friendly piece.
      colorsTurnItIs - The color of the king to be tested for if it's in check.
      colorOnTop - The color playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      A boolean, whether this color's king is in check.

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard(int[][] boardArray)
      Prints the contents of a boardArray in a pretty-printed format. Used in some try/catch blocks to print the boardArray that was involved in the exception being thrown, for reproducibility purposes.
      Parameters:
      boardArray - An int[8][8] array that is the chessboard representation used explicitly by methods in this static class, and internally by the Chessboard object.
      See Also:
      • Chessboard

    • loadBoardArrayFromFile

      public static int[][] loadBoardArrayFromFile(String fileName) throws BoardArrayFileParsingException, IOException
      Takes a fileName pointing to a CSV file, imports and parses it, returning an int[][] that can be used as the first argument to a Chessboard constructor, with Chessboard.setBoardArray(), or with the utility methods in BoardArrays. The CSV file must have no header, exactly 8 rows, exactly 8 columns, and contain only integers. Every integer must be either a 0 or a valid piece-integer value; see the piece constants defined at the top of BoardArrays.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The filename of the CSV file to import.
      Returns:
      An int[8][8] array representing a chessboard, suitable for use by a Chessboard object.
      Throws:
      BoardArrayFileParsingException - If the file doesn't have 8 rows, if a row doesn't have 8 columns, if a cell in the CSV table isn't an integer, or if an integer found doesn't parse as a valid piece integer.
      IOException - If there's an error reading from the file, or it's missing.
      See Also:
      • Chessboard
      • BoardArrays
